sub_title: I am versatile and results-driven professional, offering comprehensive experience in financial management, operational excellence, and customer service within the hospitality industry.
summary:
Every business needs top talent; this is where I come into play.
 
My name is Frank A. Chilelli and I am skilled in implementing industry best practice methods for financial improvement and valuable commercial insights delivery while executing efficient financial processes to determine financial prospects and meet fiscal goals. What makes me stand out are my solid skills in initiating and incorporating strategic operational initiatives to maximize profit margins, reduce cost, optimize processes, and improve efficiency.
 
Employers recognize me for delivering best-in-class customer service and cultivating productive relationships with them while solving issues and improving their satisfaction levels. I am instrumental in collaborating and working closely with multiple cross-functional teams to determine needs for multiple views & insights and increasing overall work efficiency.
 
I have a prominent career marked with a consistent record of top work performance and achievements. I have proven my ability to quickly comprehend and communicate complex technical situations and structures while promoting effective governance and positive change that improved productivity, efficiency, and revenues.
 
I have possessed expertise in project & QA management, strategic planning & analysis, marketing research & analysis, brand management, budgeting, hotel management, vendor relations & negotiation, and food & beverage control. I am known for being creative, open-minded, enthusiastic, confident, trustworthy, ethical, organized, and hands-on.
 
I am committed to superior services through a positive attitude and leadership within a fast-paced environment. I am extremely versatile and adaptable to industry needs.
 
Please feel free to connect with me or contact me at frank.a.chilelli@gmail.com with any thoughts, comments, or questions about my work, I'm always interested in making new professional acquaintances.

profile_positions.description:
During this period, I undertook accountability for online accounting/bookkeeping, payroll processing, IRS compliance, and quarterly tax reporting. As well as I led and conducted all aspects of small to large special events/fundraisers. While, planning and launching Frank & Cents during the niche market for offering accounting services, business strategies, and even planning to small businesses, non-profit organizations, and small restaurant owners. Moreover, I coordinated with the company to provide A-Z services, accounting/financial, tax compliance, payroll, business development, and administration.

My key contributions are:

• Decreased overhead for a staff accountant and enabled 24x7 access to key decision makers for financial records by streamlining and completing the migration process of bookkeeping systems to QuickBooks Online.
• Grew client base by 300%+ in just the first year of launching the company and facilitated small non-profit organizations for raising donation income of $1M+ through direct mail, community outreach, and charity events.
• Ensured company's growth by delivering outside perspective on operations insights and marketing plans to fiscal approaches.
• Contributed to the success of company progression and improved client base by 40% within 12 months.

My key clients are:

• Sorrento Hotel, Tougo Coffee Company, Hepatitis Education Project, Hilltop Children's Center, Open Arms Perinatal Services, Jubilee Women's Center, Community Birth Center of Seattle, and other project-based clients.

Additional Experience:

Heathman Hotel, Kirkland, WA | Hotel/Restaurant/Spa Controller/Assistant General Manager, 2007 to 2008
Tommy Bahama Inc., Seattle, WA | Restaurant/Retail Division Corporate Accountant, 2006 to 2007
Shilshole Bay Beach Club/Apulent Catering Corp, Seattle, WA | General Manager, 2004 to 2006 & Finance Manager, 2003 to 2004
profile_positions.title: Principal

profile_positions.description:
Aiming to attain set goals, I controlled all daily operational activities of full service 100 seats Italian restaurant. As well as, I dealt with menu creation and execution (changed menus seasonally), accounting, payroll, tax reporting, social media postings, and content and advertising. Along these, I streamlined the recruitment process, including hiring, onboarding, and training service, bartender, barista, and kitchen staff, while managing staff scheduling and food & beverage ordering.

My key contributions are:

• Enhanced revenues by 25% by negotiating terms of contracts with vendors and conducting social media & community events.
• Generated revenues by 15% by coordinating closely with the local government and residential community to expand and extend the restaurants' patio/terrace opening to an additional 30 seats outside.
profile_positions.title: Business Owner

profile_positions.description:
The Customer Service Agent is responsible for assisting guests with travel needs at Alaska Airlines. As a member of the passenger service team, this individual contributor role responds to guest inquiries and performs various tasks in ticketing, check-in, and boarding areas. 

Assist guests with travel needs (e.g., answering inquiries, ticketing, checking-in passengers, and boarding flights) in a fast-paced environment.
Sell tickets and ensure cabin accommodations.
Perform computer and paperwork tasks.
Evaluate and prepare flights by arranging seat assignments and load, coordinating special meals, and upgrades.
Perform boarding and gate duties (e.g., checking flight tickets, assisting and directing passengers, making announcements, checking aircraft, and confirming cabin security).
Process and secure passenger luggage.
profile_positions.title: Customer Services Agent
